subject: Law
title: Genetic Privacy and Discrimination
description: A quick win: understand Genetic Privacy and Discrimination.

hook.text: An insurer finds your genetic data shows cancer risk. They raise your rates. Is that legal? It depends on the law.

buildup.text: Genetic information reveals health risks but also creates potential for discrimination in employment and insurance.

discovery.text: GINA (2008) bans genetic discrimination in employment and health insuranceâ€”but not life or disability insurance.

twist.text: DNA databases used by police raise privacy concerns. Genetic genealogy caught the Golden State Killerâ€”but at what cost?

climax.text: Millions have shared DNA via consumer tests. Who owns it and who can access it remain open legal questions.

punchline.text: Your DNA is your blueprint. Protecting it is the new legal frontier.
